text: Middle Eastern Canadians are Canadians with ancestry, origins, or citizenship from the Middle East, which includes Western Asia and North Africa. == Terminology == == History == Individuals from the Middle East first arrived in Canada in 1882, when a group of Lebanese immigrants settled in Montreal. During the first world war, Middle Eastern Canadians of Turkish origin were placed in “enemy alien" internment camps. The middle eastern Canadian population grew rapidly during the latter half of the 20th century; the 1979 Islamic revolution in Iran resulted in a spike of immigration to Canada from the West Asian country The Syrian refugee crisis during the 2010s fueled further growth in the middle eastern Canadian population. == Demography == {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- |+ Middle Eastern population by province or territory (2016) |- ! scope="col" | Province / territory ! scope="col" | Population ! scope="col" | Percentage |- ! scope="row" |20px Ontario |610,005 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Quebec |465,920 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Alberta |120,590 | |- ! scope="row" |20px British Columbia |109,400 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Nova Scotia |19,235 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Manitoba |15,540 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Saskatchewan |11,605 | |- ! scope="row" |20px New Brunswick |8,035 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Newfoundland and Labrador |3,290 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Prince Edward Island |1,830 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Northwest Territories |390 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Yukon |230 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Nunavut |130 | |- ! scope="row" |20px Canada |1,366,190 |'''''' |} === Ethnic and national origins === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:right" |+ Demography by region and ethnicity |- | rowspan=2 | ! style="text-align:center;" colspan="2"|2016 |- ! font-size:90%;"|1Includes responses of 'Arab,' not otherwise specified. 2Includes general responses indicating West Asian, Central Asian and Middle Eastern origins as well as more specific responses that have not been included elsewhere (e.g., 'Baloch,' 'Circassian'). |} === Language === The vast majority of Middle Eastern Canadians speak West Asian and North African languages as a mother tongue or second language. The top five middle eastern languages spoken in Canada include Arabic, Farsi, Armenian, Turkish and Hebrew. === Religion === Islam, Christianity and Judaism are the dominant religions among the middle eastern Canadian population. == See also == * Afghan Canadians * Armenian Canadians * Egyptian Canadians * Iranian Canadians * Iraqi Canadians * Israeli Canadians * Jewish Canadians * Kurdish Canadians * Lebanese Canadians * Moroccan Canadians * Palestinian Canadians * Syrian Canadians * Turkish Canadians == References == Category:Ethnic groups in Canada
title: Middle Eastern Canadians
